answers.answer: I'm sorry to hear about your recurrence..but a 2 year remission is wonderful.  I do not have diabetes or heart stents,but I had Doxil after my first line chemo failed me.  They will keep a good watchful eye on your heart and usually start with a prelimanary echo-cardiogram. Doxil gave me 13 months of remssion and was fairly easy to tolerate for me.  Good luck~~~Joanne

I just finished with Doxil ---- they did a MUGA scan of my heart before my chemo and midway through to make sure my heart was ok -- I don't know how diabetes factors in -- just stay hydrated and stay away from hot showers,baths, and tight clothes and shoes --- they won't give you the Doxil if they think there is too much risk with your heart -- I did not end up in remission but have such a small amount of cancer left they are treating me with arimidex hoping it will stay stable so I can get a chemo breakGood luck with itJeanne

Go to the Doxil website for more tips and suggestions. I would suggest you ice your feet the night before your Doxil treatment and the ENTIRE time you are receiving the dose the next day. Sip on cold, iced drinks during the infusion as well. Watch your hands and feet for hand/foot syndrome which can be painful rashes and blisters. Take COQ10 supplements for your heart. Best of luck to you, Deandra
Hello Vera, I can't add any info on Doxil as i'm not taking that particular treatment,  but  wanted to wish you the best of luck with your treatments!!

Your 2 year remission was wonderful! I was on Doxil for several months. Make sure that you follow all suggestions given to you as far as what to do and what not to do following your treatments and if you experience anything that is not normal do not hesitate to let your Dr know.Chris
Why do all of you say to wear loose clothes when taking Doxil?Teresa

Any pressure can cause blistering and skin irritation -- no elastic or tight bras or clothes or high heeled shoes.  You will be sorry if you do  -- I couldn't believe how dumb I was for not thinking about the bra......You also should take at least 50mg of B6 to counter some of the Doxil side effects -- and ice your wrists and palms during infusion also along with your ankles and feet -- you get cold but it beats the alternative.......No hot baths, no hot showers -- after a while you get used to lukewarm. You really should go to Doxil.com and call their support line (I think it's an 877 number) They will send you ice packs and info and stuff --- stay hydrated and moisturize -- it will also help the skin.Jeanne

question: i just came out of a 2 year remission from ovarian cancer stage 3c. i was treated with a radical histerectomy, debulking and cisplatin/taxil as chemotherapy (2 sites: ip and iv).now the cancer is back and the oncologist wants to treat me with doxil. I have type 1 diabetes and 2 cardiac stents. i am very worried about the side effects
title: recurrent ovarian cancer and the use of doxil as a treatment
